'''Aravir''' ({{TA|2156}}<ref>{{PM|Elendil}}, p. 196</ref> - {{TA|2319|n}},<ref name="North">{{App|North}}</ref> died aged 163) was the fourth [[Chieftain of the Dúnedain]], following his father, [[Aranuir]], upon his death in 2247. 

==History==
Aravir's rule was uneventful, except for the usual skirmishes with [[orcs]]. Aravir died in {{TA|2319|n}}, after having been Chieftain for seventy-two years, and was followed by his son [[Aragorn I]].<ref name="North"/>

==Etymology==
''Aravir'' is a [[Sindarin]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but the Association Tolkiendil suggests it means "Royal Jewel".<ref name=Tolkiendil>{{webcite|author=Association Tolkiendil|articleurl=https://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names|articlename=Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth|website=Tolkiendil|accessed=05 February 2022}}</ref> It is probably a compound of the prefix ''[[ara|ar(a)-]]'' ("noble", "royal", "high") and the [[lenition|lenited]] form ''vir'' of ''mîr'' ("jewel", "treasure", precious thing).<ref name=Tolkiendil/><ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2500979369.html|articlename=S. ''Aravir'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=05 February 2022}}</ref>
